article.headline: Boise St. 78, UC Santa Barbara 76
article.story: SANTA BARBARA, Calif. -- La'Shard Anderson made a put-back basket as time expired, giving Boise State a 78-76 overtime victory against UC Santa Barbara in a BracketBusters game on Saturday night. Paul Noonan had 20 points for the Broncos (15-11) to become the 20th player in school history to eclipse 1,000 for his career. Daequon Montreal added 19 points and Anderson 18. Orlando Johnson tied the game with a 3-pointer with 8.5 seconds left in overtime for UC Santa Barbara (14-11). After Boise State took possession, Wes Perryman's 3-point attempt missed, but Anderson was under the basket at the right time. Johnson -- who forced overtime by making two free throws with four seconds left in regulation -- had 25 points and James Nunnally 21 for the Gauchos.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
